p: Hoet et al. (2006) [ 59] analyzed the essential oil from the leaves of Strychnos spinosa (Loganiaceae). Twenty-two compounds were identified in the oil; the main constituents were palmitic acid (34.3%) and linalool (16.0%). The in vitro activity of the essential oil and 15 components against T. brucei brucei and mammalian cells were analyzed. The essential oil was active against the parasite without a high selectivity [IC 50 in T. b. brucei = 13.5 µg/mL, SI = 4.4]. ( E)-Nerolidol and linalool showed a more potent and selective effect on trypanosomes [IC 50 = 1.7 and 2.5 µg/mL (7.6 and 16.3 µM).
